Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of the travel ban in saving many lives from the spread of COVID-19 in the U.S.
Understate: The claim understates the number of Chinese and foreign nationals from Hong Kong and Macau who entered the U.S. in the three months following the travel restrictions.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the February restrictions helped save thousands or millions of lives.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the travel ban was a major factor in preventing the spread of COVID-19 in the U.S., which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the decrease in COVID-19 cases in the U.S., and the claim fails to acknowledge them.
